events.title: First Plastic Surgery Clinic Opens
events.description: Dr. Harold Gillies established the world's first hospital ward dedicated to plastic surgery in Sidcup, England, pioneering modern reconstructive surgery techniques.
events.significance: This event marked a major advancement in medical science, particularly in the treatment of war injuries and among civilians requiring reconstructive procedures.

events.title: Al Capone Convicted of Tax Evasion
events.description: Famous American gangster Al Capone was convicted on charges of tax evasion, leading to his imprisonment.
events.significance: Capone's conviction demonstrated the effectiveness of using financial crimes to bring down organized crime figures, influencing law enforcement tactics.

events.title: Mother Teresa Awarded the Nobel Peace Prize
events.description: Mother Teresa received the Nobel Peace Prize for her humanitarian work among the poor and sick in Calcutta, India.
events.significance: Her recognition brought global attention to issues of poverty and humanitarian aid, inspiring many to volunteer and support charitable causes.

events.title: Syrian Uprising Intensifies
events.description: Significant violent clashes occurred in Syria, marking an escalation in the Syrian Civil War with numerous casualties reported.
events.significance: This marked a critical point in the ongoing conflict that would have lasting regional and international implications.
